answers.answer: You don't really have to do anything different.I failed my 1 hour but passed my 3 hour test. I had to fast for bothas far as I'm concerned,  nothing will be affected.If you do fail the 3 hour,  you just have to check your blood a few times a day, change your diet and baby may be monitored more so you don't have a big baby.Having gestational diabetes doesn't change much honestly with your baby
If I do have GD ( god forbids) will I have to have a c-section ?
Well I failed as well I drank alot of water before I went and I passed they check it again later I heard
@BabyandChey lol the glucose test & water will be my best friend @meglovesmario

With my 1st I failed both my tests but just by a couple points. I controlled my GD with diet and checking my blood 2 hours after every meal ...it wasnt that bad. My lil boy wieghed 8.7lbs.You do not HAVE to have a csection if you do have GD. Now I'm preg with my 2nd I failed my 1hr test and when I did my 3hr one I walked around between each blood drawing and I passed it! Don't be afraid if you do have GD tho... they usually offer a class if you are diagnosed and it helps a lot!
Yes mam let me know how it goes good luck :) u got this lol
How many weeks are you that they do the GD test. I figured it would be my next appointment (im 20w) but she didn't say anything about it
Calico I didn't do mine until 26 weeks
I failed but I had low blood sugar and that was the last thing they said to me about it
I had high levels, you are not suppose to eat after 12 a.m
Usually around 28 weeks.  I failed the first time with my second pregnancy and then passed the 3 hour.

question: Just got a call from my nurse saying I failed and have to go back and take a 3hr test, this ***** but a few ?'s1. What will I have to do differently ?2. How will this effect my delivery?3. Will this mess up my chances of breastfeeding ?My nurse called basically told me I failed & that I had to fast again and to come in fri am , nothing else now im neevous :(
title: failed 1hr test
